prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James City County (Va.) Architectural Drawings, 1977-1989. Local government records collection, James City County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, James City County, VA 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court records from James City County under accession number 52038.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: James City County was named for King James I. It was one of the eight shires, or counties, enumerated in 1634. Subsequent additions from the Williamsburg section of York County were made in 1769, 1852, and 1880. The county courthouse is the city of Williamsburg, and the county administrative offices are near Kingsmill in the county.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: James City County (Va) Architectural Drawings, 1977-1989, include the following: 5 drawings dated 1977, 1978, and 1985 of folded heating and cooling drawings of demolished Administration building; 1 drawing dated 1977 of elevator of demolished Administration building; and 2 drawings dated 1989 of remodeling of 2 different architectural designs of demolished mosquito building.
